lead_paragraph: PECK--Norman. The Trustees and staff of The Metropolitan Museum of Art mourn the loss of Norman Peck who, as Director of the Peter J. Sharp Foundation, carried on the legacy of generosity to the Museum begun by Benefactor and late Trustee Peter Sharp. Under Norman's stewardship, the foundation made vital contributions to the American Wing establishing The Peter Jay Sharp Foundation Endowment Fund in support of American art exhibitions, including the currently on view Artistic Furniture of the Gilded Age; supporting the recent major capital project to renovate the Wing; and funding additional curatorial and education projects. In appreciation, the Peter Jay Sharp Foundation Gallery (Gallery 760) was named in the foundation's honor. We are deeply grateful for Norman's long-term involvement and dedication, and for the benefits that these gifts continue to provide to The Met and its visitors from around the world, now and in the future. Daniel Brodsky, Chairman Thomas P. Campbell, Director and CEO Daniel H. Weiss, President 1/3
